crcl.utils

Class PoseToleranceChecker

  • java.lang.Object
    • crcl.utils.PoseToleranceChecker

  • public class PoseToleranceChecker
extends Object
    Utility class for comparing pose differences with required tolerances.
    Author:
    Will Shackleford <william.shackleford@nist.gov>,<wshackle@gmail.com>

      • isInTolerance

        public static boolean isInTolerance(crcl.base.VectorType v1,
                                    crcl.base.VectorType v2,
                                    @Nullable Double tol,
                                    crcl.base.AngleUnitEnumType angleType)
        Check to see if the angle between two vectors exceeds a given tolerance
        Parameters:
        v1 - first vector
        v2 - second vector
        tol - maximum angle to allow, if null always return true
        angleType - AngleUnitEnumType.DEGREE or AngleUnitEnumType.RADIAN
        Returns:
        two vectors differ by an angle less than the tolerance

      • isInTolerance

        public static boolean isInTolerance(crcl.base.PoseType pose1,
                                    crcl.base.PoseType pose2,
                                    crcl.base.PoseToleranceType tol,
                                    crcl.base.AngleUnitEnumType angleType)
        Check the differences between each field of two poses to see if they are within the given tolerance.
        Parameters:
        pose1 - first pose
        pose2 - second pose
        tol - tolerance
        angleType - units for tol axis fields
        Returns:
        whether all field differences are less than or equal to the limits in tol.
